name: Quick Hawaiian Haystacks
author: Maria Tedjamulia
summary: Yummy, easy-to-make meal that can feed the masses. This recipe can be modified in so many fun, different ways. If you have ideas on how to mix it up, please comment below. I'd love to try your add-ins! Add more toppings to suit your taste.
ingredients: 2 (10.5 ounce) cans cream of chicken soup
3  cooked chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
½ cup milk, or more as needed
1 teaspoon soy sauce, or to taste
directions: Mix chicken soup and chicken together in a saucepan; stir in enough milk to make a gravy-like consistency
Cook and stir chicken sauce over medium heat until smooth and heated through, 5 to 10 minutes
Layer each serving of rice with chow mein noodles, the chicken mixture, pineapple, Cheddar cheese, celery, green peppers, green onions, coconut, almonds, and a drizzle of soy sauce, respectively
